lexUnit.name: drone.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a low continuous humming sound.

sentence.text: Remarkable how long a nasal drone and a cheap synth can sustain a man .
The only other noise was from huge bumble-bees , flying like World War II plans , with a low drone that dropped even lower as they shot over my nose .
There was the distant drone of an alarm and things began to thaw .
From where we sat we could hear their occasional bursts of laughter and the dim drone of their voices , but the words themselves were lost to us .
It sounded so comfortable and reassuring , like the drone of a distant mowing machine through the class-room window at school .
After half an hour , when the drone of an engine approached from behind , I had to bring every muscle into play to maintain a normal walk .
I fall asleep to the drone of sirens and helicopters overhead .
Above them they heard the drone of engines as a German bomber swept in to land .
And she finally ends by saying , ` All I can look forward to now is the toneless drone of the master 's voice and the pendulum swing of his leg over the desk . "
She heard the drone of some bees in the garden and the angry chatter of birds disputing over their seeds .
From somewhere far away comes the drone of a mower , and the smell of the cut grass .
No sound , except the lazy drone of the cicadas in the trees .
Sorvino could n't think of a better reason to get away from the ice-pick drone of the alarm .
Out of the drone of insect life around us I could distinguish the sound of an aeroplane engine .
Far off she heard the drone of a tractor working late or set for home .
Maxim had a torch which he used very cautiously , but at least they did n't have to whisper in the steady drone of rain .
The drone of something like a vacuum cleaner or hair dryer -- so-called ` white noise " -- often sends a fractious baby to sleep , or at least stops her grizzling .
